newsitem.title: GREECE: Ecu/drachma eases, depos, forwards, bonds stable.
newsitem.headline: Ecu/drachma eases, depos, forwards, bonds stable.

text.p: Greek depos and forex forwards were holding but for a minor drop in one-year forwards on a weaker dollar, bonds were steady and ecu/drachma easier in early dealings, dealers said.
"Depos and forex forwards are sitting tight in early scant trading," said a trader at a private bank. "One-year forwards are slightly lower on a weaker dollar."
A lower CPI-based inflation figure for April will not affect depos and forwards, the dealer said.
April CPI inflation eased to 5.9 percent year-on-year in April from 6.0 percent in March, a monetary source told Reuters. The official inflation figure will be released later on.
"The lower inflation figure has been discounted," said the dealer. "Rates will make waves if the the central bank chnages its deposit facility rates."
Bond dealers said the market was quiet and prices were holding.
"Buying interest for both taxable and non-taxable fixed coupon bonds emerged late on Wednesday from abroad especially when New York opened," said a bond dealer at a private bank.
The mark was quoted at 158.86/91 from Wednesday's 158.780 fix, the dollar at 271.96/06 drachmas from 273.330 and the ecu at 309.47/57 from 309.660 drachmas.
"Ecu/drachma is easier trading around 309.45/50," said a private bank dealer.
